tagDescription: to Wm.Burns. Information regarding death and burial of Mrs.Johnston. Requests two quarts of whiskey per bearer for which settlement will be made by Mr.Cartwright.
List of partial payments outstanding due by James Williams.

to Selkirk . Gives cursory sketch of Baldoon Settlement by the opportunity afforded by Capt. Gilkinson ' s departure for Europe. Left Baldoon 1st Sept. People are well. Leaves Stewart, McDonald, Young, and McLean on home farm.John and Donald McDonald from P. Edward Island have been paid off. Has been a victim of fever. Rec'd his letter of 1st July on arrival at Fort Erie.Mr.Sym misinformed by John McDonald as to situation of Settlement. Has drawn $3100 of the £1000 to his credit with LeRoy Bayard & McEvers. Is obliged to draw on Messrs.Ransom Moreland & Co. for L1500 Provl. Cy. Will transmit full statement of expenditure.

to Wm.Burns. Requests information re his passage out. The Bess in good order.Will sail for Lisbon on 7th inst. and on arrival there will prepare the ship to take in cargo for Quebec. Doubts have been raised regarding renewal of war with French.
Memorandum letter to James Williams from Lord Selkirk. States that Capt.McDonald's orders be considered as his own.
to James Williams. Refers him to Capt. McDonald with his explanations concerning state of Settlement in P.E.I.

to Selkirk. Found sheep at Baldoon in bad shape.Will return to York for family after crops are in,and will then return to Baldoon to stay. Has secured a man to make brick and do necessary building at Settlement.List of settlers who are located on 50 acres and those who ought to be located. Expecting Innes & Grant's account by first boat from Sandwich.Suggests a list of articles that might be sent out for use of settlers to save heavy expense. Grist mill much needed.Will feel himself justified in paying late Mr.Burns' account with Fisher the Blacksmith.Encloses list of settlers and their families. Account of an encounter of a number of fishermen with the American Collector.
to Alex. Mundell. Decline entering any arrangements on their account with Spraggon,May & Co. Enclose agreements and letter to Williams.
to Lord Selkirk. Detailed report as to transactions at Settlement in. P.P.E.I.(Enclosed in James Stewart's to Lord Selkirk of 27 Nov. 1807.)

to Alex. MacDonell. Much displeased with his conduct. Acquiesces in necessity of abandoning Baldoon for present. Instructions re releasing of settlers,distribution of live stock.Care and preservation of sheep flock. Hiring of hands for cutting a road. Purchase of Grand River land as place of settlement instead of Baldoon. Necessity of separate accounts to be sent in for settlement and personal expenditure.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with Matthew Dolsen.
Account of John Brown with Daniel McDonald per Mdse.
Receipt of Jacob Horsen for Alex.MacDonell in favor of George Sweener.

to Alex.MacDonell. Pleased with purchase of Jarvis's block.Requests survey of same,and lease of pasture lands for sheep flock from Indians. Does not wish to take block on Grand River beyond Wallace's. No objections to settling four or five families below little Bear Creek,but prefers up towards Tredell's.Will arrange for credit on Montreal drafts to be on Ransom, Moreland & Co.Not much chance of disposing of saleable lands.
to Alex.MacDonell. Order to pay £6 N.Y.Cy. To Matthew Dolsen and charge to his account.
Itemized account of Lord Selkirk with LeRoy, Bayard & McEvers from Sept. 18-30.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Bercy, Bayard & McEvers from Sept. 18-30.
Abstract of the affairs of P.E.I. which are now pending and have been brought forward by different applications from the proprietors to Government by J.Stewart.
to Wm.Burn. His letter long in coming to hand.Will sail by St.Lawrence to Canada rather than New York. Requests that he meet him in Canada,but to await further orders.
Proposal of Asa Osborn to make and deliver brick for and to Lord Selkirk.His prices.
Memo. re stores on hand July 15th, 1804.
Miscellaneous estimates pr.James Williams.

to Selkirk. Expense great in care of sick. Mitchell returned to Settlement on 13th and Brown with sheep on 14th.Whirlwind on 15th did much damage. Has written Stewart to come to the Settlement. People discontented.Awaits instructions as to manner he is to act.
Paln of the Farm at Baldoon. Account of Lord Selkirk with Alex.Roxburgh.
Escheat Bill-Prince Edward Island.

to Lord Selkirk. Is distressed at His Lordship's displeasure with his proceedings.Will remain at Baldoon till further commands are received. Has never said anything against late Wm.Burns.Burwell not proceeding with survey of Wedderburn. Smith surveying Dover and Chatham. He is to bring Canadians from American side to work farms in the Province and settle thereon. Encloses statement of Burn's accounts.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Thomas Clark from Jany. to Oct.1810.

Scroll Copy letter of John McDonald. Williams still at P.E.I. Instructions re investigation into Williams administration at P.E.I. Has written to Mr.Stewart re Power of Attorney to be sent in case of necessity.Publicity of dissatisfaction felt over Williams'conduct unnecessary.
to Wm.Burn. Will furnish him with potatoes at same price as anywhere else.
Account of Wm.Burns with Lewis Berry for sheep's wool and storage.
Receipt for tobacco bought by Wm.Burns,of Innes & Grant.
Account of Expences from Baldoon to London and at London from July 1811 to March 1812.Also miscellaneous receipts and orders in connection with Wm.Burn's accounts.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innes & Grant for provisions received.
Receipted account of Alex.Brown for care of a ram.
Order to Mathias Crow to pay above to John Reynold(written on back of above)

to Earl of Selkirk. Is unable to transmit complete statement of affairs in U.C. until receipt of list of debts due by settlers, from MacDonell.Encloses list of papers that have already been sent. Remarks on sheep farming. Recommends abandoning Baldoon as a place unfit for farming and sheep raising. States amount of his account and directions re payment.
Calculation re drainage of Baldoon Settlement per data from Jessop.
to Lord Selkirk re Report made on wool in Upper Canada.
to Wm.Burn. Has changed his plans.He(Burns)without waiting longer is to sail for N.Y. to take charge of sheep.Alex.Brown, a shepherd,is to accompany him.
Receipt of Hugh McCallum for purchase of 200 lbs. pork by Alex.MacDonell.
Account of MacDonell with James Chuney for overhalls.Receipted.
Account of John Brown to Matthew Dolsen for May and June, 1810.
Receipted Bill for Peter MacDonell's board by James Ross to Alex. MacDonell's account.
Inventory of sheep stock of 1807-08.
Accounts of Charles Fisher for Smith work done at Baldoon 1809 .
to Wm.Berens.(Burns.) Requests his patronage when provisions are needed.Will have flour to deliver by 1st June;whiskey in Fall.
Receipt of R.Savage from Lewis Farquharson for $56 for articles purchased.
Memorandum of accounts by Lewis Farquharson.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant.Dec.1810-July,1811.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant for Mdse. Receipted.
List of James Williams drafts on Ransom ,Moreland & Co.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Matthew Dolsen for £11-9-3.Receipted by John Dolsen.
Speech of Lt-Govr.Des Barres at the close of the session of the General Assembly,Prince Edward Island.
Account of Wm.Burn with Matthew Dolson from Jany to Feb. 1804.
to Wm.Burns. Lord Selkirk's disappointment at his(Burn's) resolution of not going to America to take charge of sheep. Begs that he reconsider the matter.
Bill & Receipt of James Ross for board of Peter McDonell.
Receipt of Selby for a horse sold by Lt-Gov.Gore.
to MacDonell. Gives notification of last payment made for Peter MacDonell's board and encloses account from April to May.
Receipted Bill of James Ross for Board of Peter MacDonell.
Memorandum of an Agreement. Between Lord Selkirk and Sparggon,May & Co. for lease of Lot 10 P.E.I., and right to cut pine,etc. thereon for 6 years.
Extract from the Albany Gazette re duel which occurred on 10th Oct. at Niagara between Messrs. Weekes and Dickson, and which proved fatal to Weekes.
Account of John Sims.M.D. with Lord Selkirk for 1807-08-09.
to Wm.Burn. List of articles sent him to the care of Messrs.Innes & Grant.Ronald and Angus MacDonell also sent. No accounts from Lord Selkirk as yet.

Scroll Copy.Letter to Thomas Clark apparently from Lord Selkirk. Information communicated of great use. Will wait further communication before giving up farming at Baldoon.Requests assistance in settlement of Dr.Sims' accounts and states agreement made with him at time of his appointment,also his claims.

to Selkirk. Clark declines drawing on London Broker as requested owing, as he says, to insufficient power vested in him. Is inconvenienced by having to pay interest on monies borrowed. Selby dead at York.Would give detailed account of events,were it within his power. Govt. House just been burned.Army embarked to perform similar exploit at River Credit.
Scroll Copy letter to John McDonald of Glenanadale. (Unsigned.) Recommending him to prepare to come to Prince Edward Island.
to Wm.Burn. Requests instructions re getting the sheep accross the river. Also information respecting the death of his wife.
Receipt of Jacob Horsen for carpenter work done at Baldoon.
Receipt of William Brown for money rec'd from John Brown on Alex.MacDonell's account.
Receipt of John Sims for set of Bills on Ranson,Moreland & Co., to the account of Lord Selkirk.
Note of John Brown to Wm.Brown for $10.25 on Alex.MacDonell's account.

to Wm.Burn. Has forwarded his two letters to Miss Bacon and is now enclosing her two in answer.Little alteration in plans since he(Burn) left. Markets good. Informs him of death of Mr.Rimmer. Expects to get share in concern with Mr.Alison.

to Lord Selkirk. Re state of politics of P.E.I. Information re different classes of people on Island.Report on crops of 1806.Dr. MacAuley,land interest,quit rents,etc. States reasons for not wanting Island separate from N.S. Defense of Canadas. Objects of the Club of Loyal Electors.
List of Quit Rents due on the Earl of Selkirk's lands in Prince Edwards Island May 1st. 1808.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Thomas Clark.

to Lord Selkirk. Rec'd first tidings of Baldoon Catastrophe at Fort Erie while on way to York. Encloses paragraph from York Gazette re same.Few who were not sick. Left Birkett in charge on account of death of Peter McDonald. Will continue his salary for a year longer from 1st April next. Has rec'd letter from Quebec. Will answer soon.

to Selkirk . Has received his letter of 7th Ulto. Expenditure at Baldoon less than he expected. Will proceed to Washington next month as directed. Has located Allan & John, sons of Angus McDonald Sent on 100 acres each at Little Bear Creek. Trusts arrangements re Home Farm will meet approval. Has brought sheep sent out by Brown, from Queenston. They are in good condition.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant for Mdse.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Matthew Dolsen for goods from Nov.1809 to July, 1810.

to Selkirk . Encloses accounts with observations.Has been delayed in transmitting same. Home farm progressing favorably. A lot given to Angus MacDonell.Has continued Widow Buchanan allowance of flour. Lt.-Gov. Gore of opinion that no additional fee can be imposed on Grants. Loss of Speedy much felt in Province.Successor to Justice Cochran causing great disturbance.
List of Sheep taken on the Island the 20th June, 1808.

to Selkirk. Account of the general meeting of the Chiefs of the Six Nation Indians at rear of Lake Ontario.Made offer for upper reservation and tract on S.W. side of Grand River; also agreement with Dickson for purchase of his claim. Amount of purchase money needed. Was disppointed by Surveyor not appearing at Chippawa Creek. Strong evidence in proof of the practicability of opening a canal between the Rivers Chippawa and Grand. Purposes petitioning Lt.Gov. for Island last of mouth of Gd.River as soon as doubts have been removed re purchase of last tract. Stedman's block, conditionnally sold to Mr.Aug.Jones at last Council.Suggests purchase of remaining part of tract granted to Six Nation Indians from N.W.boundary line of Clark's block to sources of Grand River. Mr.Parish would probably like to invest in it.Encloses plan of tract on N.E.side of lower reservation and adjoining Townships to its mouth and proposed site of Canal by Lt-Gen. Simcoe.Will repair to Baldoon soon. Dr.Sims taken over management of farm and sheep. Remarks on Mr.Mitchell's alleged expenditures. Is not able to enclose Clark's account with his. Has drawn on Ransom,Moreland & Co. in favor of Mr. Dickson and Mr.Wood. Suggests that application be made for Townships of Wainfleat.

to Lord Selkirk . Has been detained by being Executor of his late Brother's Estate. People at Balddon recovering health and spirits. Loss and disease among sheep. Will send information as to progress of Settlement of Baldoon, on arrival there. Encloses letters from Messrs. LeRoy, Bayard and McEvers re expiration of credit placed with them and to his favor. Will also give account of money used when Baldoon is reached.Awaits further instructions.
Memo. Of Spraggon,May & Co. Re lease of saw and grist mill for twenty years and lease of Lot. 10 for 6 years with exclusive right to cut pine. Cedar,Oak,&c.,P.E.I.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with Thomas Clark for merchandise.
to John Sims. States details of several interviews re his administration as physician at Baldoon.

to Wm.Burn. His two letters received.Expects to see him in England next summer. His mother well and pleased to hear good news of him.Channel fleet laying off Brest in readiness against any further attack of the French.News as to family,friends,etc.

to Earl of Selkirk. Has forwarded his letter to Col.Greer in hope of overtaking Lt-Gov. before he leaves for Quebec. Encloses copy of letters to Col.Greer re occupation of land for 2 or 3 years. Has rec'd answer in negative.Mrs. Peter McDonald dead also several others. Suggests change in situation of settlement from Baldoon to Messessaque Tract. Flock of sheep has suffered much from loss. Will be under necessity of drawing on Messrs. Ransom, Morland & Co. because of overdrawing credit with LeRoy Bayard & Evers. Has not found any explanation of distillery business among brother' s papers. Was married on 8th Jany. Now Mrs McD.goes to Long Island,returns in autumn.Has been elected Speaker of H. of A. Wishes to have gown. Mr. MacDonell, the Priest, has not yet made selection of land. Chief Justice Elmsley died on way to Ball's Town Springs.
to Wm.Burns. Has sent John Galloway and James Graham as per Lord Selkirk's request for men to work for him.
List of Drafts by James Williams subsequent to Oct. 1804 ,paid by Ranson Moreland & Co.
Accounts of Alex.MacDonell with Alexander Wood.
Lands sold upon the Earl of Selkirk's Estate in the Island of Prince Edward with the purchase money rec'd to Nov.1807.
Inventory of cattle and other moveable property belonging to the Right Hon.the Earl of Selkirk at Baldoon in Upper Canada,21st June 1811.
Plan showing levels at Chenal Ecarte by T.Smith.
Observations as to longitude and latitude of Chenail Ecafte,etc.
Bill of parcels supplied Baldoon Settlement by Innis & Grant.

to Lord Selkirk, Found things in bad condition at Baldoon. Took an inventory of articles on hand. Returned to Sandwich to get sundry articles for relief of sick at Settlement. No farming done of late. Has dismissed Templemen and declined to pay him.Will return to Baldoon taking Dr. Scott. Rec'd five yoke of working oxen and 8 steers from Mr. May. One oxen drowned crossing river.

to Wm.Burn. Rec'd his letter of 24th inst,and will pay the freight of lime to Athawa.Will give him a load of bricks on his return. Requests information as to number required. Has sent Madeira wine as port could not be obtained.Has also bought 7 galls.spirits as theirs has not yet arrived.
to Wm.Burns. Offers tender for building material.
Extract of letter to John McDonald from Lord Selkirk. Is very anxious that he should help in arranging plan of Settlement if he will not enter into any business.
to Alex. MacDonell. Acknowledges favor of 20th with its enclosures.Encloses receipt for bonds and cash.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Louis Farquharson for £135-17-4. N.Y.Cy.
Plan of the Sioux Country per Cameron.No.20.
Letter to Wm.Burn.(Unsigned.) Enclosing Capt.Athaway's receipt for sixty barrels of lime which have been shipped for Lord Selkirk's account.
Memorandum of accounts of James Williams for 1803-04.
Order in Chancery re reading of Affidavit of Samuel Murcheson and motion of Mr.Roubel re Estate of Lord Selkirk.
Account of Dr.John Sims while physician at Baldoon,for 1810.
to Lord Selkirk. Notification of return of Basil Hall from P.E.I.Williams brought to full possession of senses.Encloses letter from Williams containing full and correct details of transactions.

to Lord Selkirk. Has only good to speak of Williams. Crops of last year poor but settlers contented and industrious.Island in better condition than in 1801. Refers to postscript of His Lordship's letter re establishment of settlement.
Memorandum of Power Attorney to Alex.MacDonell.

to Selkirk . Circumstances at Baldoon greatly improved. The sheep in much better condition. Presented a petition to Council on 27th of which he encloses a copy. Council not satisfied with promise of putting documents re surrender of 50 acres to head of each family in Council office within two months after passing of grant. Three lots in 156 Concession Dover and Chatham ready for appropriation by his Lordship. Has rec'd his letters and books.First volume of Rural Economy set missing. Thanks for Gown and table Linen.Mr.John McDonald to remain at Baldoon.Nothing decisive done re Grand River Lands. Suggests purchase of Indian Reserve. Two island have not yet been purchased.
List of articles sent by Innes & Grant to Wm.Burn per Mr.Wright,at Chenail Ecarte.

to Lord Selkirk. Letter of 4 March rec'd. 30 June from Mr.Stewart from Halifax.Fresh securities necessary on Wm.MacDonald's mortgage.Has rec'd. certified copies of title deeds of land on Island. Observations on Lot. 32 purchased by Sir Wm.Young.
to John McDonald. Military expedition in contemplation for object of Colonization. Refers to mode of settling of Interest on sum borrowed.
to Wm.Burns. Enclosing statement of sundrie articles that Mr.Templeton and he have received.
LeRoy,Bayard & McEver's receipt for stock to Lord Selkirk.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with Thomas Clark for Mdse.
Account of Wm.Burn with Thomas Clark settled Apr.18.'04.

to Wm.Burns. Encloses blacksmith's account. Requests that he inform Ld.Selkirk as to the name of individual who made brick for Capt.Harrow. Hopes to bring down young man to Chenail Ecarte to manage canoe.
to Alex.MacDonell. Order to pay £40 N.2.Cy. to Richard Pattinson.
to Mr.A.McDonald.Order to pay Mr. Matthew Dolson $5.00
Account of Alex.MacDonell with Thomas Clark.
Account of Wm.Burn with Thomas Clark.
List and despcription of Sheep.

to Lord Selkirk. Has communicated with Lt-Gov. re Shawanee Township.Conduct of Johnson very bad. Has drawn on Mr.Wood for £100 stg.for opening the road to River Thames. Has not heard from Burwell re street lots in Wedderburn. Awaits commands. Requests advice re settlement of two Russian prisoners at Baldoon,who understand culture of hemp.
Memorandum.Letter to Alex.MacDonell.Re miscellaneous subjects. Copy given to Rev. E.Burke,Halifax.
to Wm.Burn. List of Articles sent by their boat.
to Wm.Burn. List of articles sent by their boat.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant for Mdse.

to Lord Selkirk. Will be ready to leave for Britain in six weeks.Encloses list of bills procurable and hopes of more before departure.Encloses also letter of advice upon bills being drawn and explaining McGowan's draft.
to Lord Selkirk. Glad to be allowed to return to Britain.Complaints re title deeds destitute of foundation.No account of emigrants accompanying Mr.Robertson as yet.
Further instructions to Mr.Wm.Burn re undertakings as agent to Lord Selkirk.
Itemized account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant from Jany to April.
Estimate by Mr. Milnes of extra expence a vessel calling at Stornaway would be subjected to.Enclosed in Williams to Selkirk of Nov.24th 1804.
Return of Members of the Council and Assembly of Prince Edward Island.
Account of MacDonell with Angus MacKintosh.

to Selkirk. Arrived on 26th. Requests that Messrs.Ransom, Moreland & Co. be instructed to honor his Bills. Statement of total amount of money received. Has not drawn salary not knowing date of commencement. Matthew Dolson's account still unsettled. Wool to be forwarded early in Spring.
to Wm.Burns. Information regarding trouble with Mr.Bissell.Burns lumber man. Requests men to be forwarded by Messrs.Innes & Grant's men.Will deliver Lord Selkirk's draft at first opportunity.
Power of Attorney to James Stewart from Lord Selkirk for sale and management of his lands in Prince Edward Island.

to Selkirk. Is out on parole on account of illness. Account of misfortunes,illness and death in family. Claims balance of salary due as Sheriff at Baldoon. Requests aid in securing position of Deputy Postmaster General of the Province.
Plan of Lot 31 showing land disposed of on Sea Coast. Lands reserved and roads.
Estimates. P.E.I.

to Selkirk. Has informed Mr.Clark that conditional agreement of purchase of Grand River land is no longer binding. Has drawn in favor of Clark and also of Mr. Dickson. Lt-Gov'r. has stayed further locations in Township of Wainfleet. Offered 1/2 doller per acre for remaining lots in the Township. Russell still alive but infirm.He(MacDonell) solicits appointment as Recr-Genl.of Province.
to Lord Selkirk. Encloses copy of Letter from Williams.Papers forwarded to Mr.Charles Stewart.
Account of Alex. MacDonell with Thomas Smith for surveys performed on the North side of Lake St. Clair, W.Canada , 1809-1810.
to Rev.David Teisberger. Introducing Mr.William Burns as Agent for Lord Selkirk who goes to explore intended place of settlement.Suggests John or Charles Henry as guide for him.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with John Dolsen for £31-19-10
Account of Lord Selkirk with Thomas Clark from Oct. 1807-to Dec.1807.

to Selkirk . Has rec'd letters of Nov.2nd and July 21st with accompanying book. Encloses copy of Petition to Hon.Alex. Grant re Baldoon Settlement. "Not recommended by Council." Has had conversation with Brant re purchase of Grand River Townships. Stedman's Township not obtainable at present. If purchased,money to be paid to Trustees Claus, Stewart & Smith. Will ascertain lowest price for Wallace's Tract. Deed completed but not issued for same. Leaves Monday for Baldoon with Mr. Baby. Encloses copy of Hambey's Field Notes & Survey. Cannot say what settlers were employed at. Impossible to give estimate of future expenditure. Stewart arrived A.M. paid and despatched. Seemed satisfied. Late Peter McDonald's three sons at school in Amherstburgh. Requests directions as to how they are to be disposed of.
to Wm.Burns. Requesting that he write often.
Memo. re building material and sheep.
from Jany. To Mar., 1809.
to Genl.Fanning. Reports re cultivation of soil and industry of settlers.
to Earl of Selkirk. Difficulty in handling sheep during last winter.Great loss. Much need of reinforcement of troops. Will write as soon as relief comes.
Memorandum.Letter to Alex.MacDonell. Re medical attendance. Instruction of settlers and steps taken re care of sheep.
Hills account of the affairs etc. of Prince Edward Island.

to Wm.Burn. A.Brown,shepherd to Ld.S.in America, will take passage on the Bess. Ld.Selkirk does not wish any others to go out till Spring.Passage of Brown to be allowed him.McCormack to pay cost of it.
Miscellaneous receipts and bills in connection with Baldon Settlement.
Journal of the House of Assembly of His Majesty's Island of Prince Edward. Second Session,seventh General Assembly.
to Lord Selkirk. Acknowledges receipt of September letter.No answer from Williams.Will comply with directions to send letter of Attorney to P.E.I. Will write again in a few days.
Receipt of D.Ransom to Mr.Burns for two hundred lbs ham., certified by Alex.MacDonell.

Scroll Copy Letter Lord Selkirk to Alex.MacDonell. Greatly disappointed over entire disregard of instructions given.Requests that he come to England with vouchers and byegone accounts;also all papers and books relating to affairs as Agent. Instructions re general statement of affairs to be made out,and arrangements during absence in England. No objection to opening road to Baldoon to River Thames,providing other expences are light.Directions re locations to settlers and handling of sheep. Requests for second time,statement of Burn's accounts.Dr. Richardson's place too expensive. Has not seen fit to pay Mr.Wood's last bill.Wool of 1809 not yet arrived.

to Rev.Michael Young. Letter of introduction for Mr.Wm.Burns who requires information and assistance respecting forming of settlement at Chenail Ecarte. Will probably require services of an intelligent Indian.
to Wm.Burn. Has heard of his arrival.Wishes to see him before he (Selkirk) leaves for York.
Instructions,apparently those of Lord Selkirk,re the gathering of labourers for his settlement in Canada. Route which he is to follow.
to Wm.Burn. States that Lord Selkirk wishes him to return to Queenston as soon as he leaves La Trench.

to Lord Selkirk. Encloses Mr.Milnes calculations of expence a vessel calling at Stornaway for passengers would be subjected to.Suggestions re the shipping of meat and meal.Allowance for Surgeon and states also those offered by Donald Nicolson,also his request re surplus money of any of the passengers.

to Selkirk. Thinks his letter of 15th has shared the fate of the Fox frigate from Quebec. Wool of 1809 with that of present year forwarded to Clas.Johnson not equal to management of farm and stock. Closed with Mr.Crow re making a new road.Offered lot to Joseph Miller as an inducement for bringing 12 families from Ohio to settle in the Province. States condition of harvest supply. Making preparations to sail for England. Will take plan of Smith's survey of Dover and islands along. Transmits copy of order re grant of Isle Tonti to Sir J.Johnson.Information re marriages of Lady and Sir.J. Johnson's sisters.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with William Allan & Co. Receipt annexed.

to Lord Selkirk. Explains delay in leaving P.E.I. Also proceedings re lumber contract.Will transmit proposals of Mr.Spraggon by next Express.Reports on the settlers. Receivings during the preceeding year,etc.
to Wm.Burns. Has rec'd his letter of Mar.24. His(Burn's) mother delighted over news from him.All the news of St-Mary's Isle.
to Wm.Burn. Requests that he refund money advanced to Mr.John McGregor to pay Isaac Bissell's account,either in cash or Bank bills.
to Wm.Burns. Advises that no more sheep be bought to be sent over as they can be bought as cheaply and are just as good in Canada. Conduct of Mr. Savage very urgentlemanly.Offers his services.
to James Stewart. Will leave for Halifax about middle of July.States condition of dam for grist and saw mills also bridges and repairs necessary.
to Wm.Burn. Has received his letter of the 24th.News of the pet cow and the neighbours.
to Lord Selkirk. Duplicate letter enclosed in above re affair with Williams in P.E.I.
to Lord Selkirk. Encloses letter from John Fraser of Pictou re James Williams.Gratuity for which he leaves to his Lordship's discretion.All accounts of Williams good so far.
to Alex.MacDonell. Order to pay second Bill to Innis & Grant.

to Lt-Gov.Gore. Is not able to give all the information promised re settlers on Indian lands on River St.Clair. One family in Shawanee Township very persistent. Lionel Thompson and James Stewart settled contrary to all advice,at lower end of Shawanee Township. Requests his interference in this matter and also that further locations in said Township be with-held until communication is received from Lord Selkirk. Will send plan of Smith's survey of islands as soon as one is protracted.
Account of A.MacDonell for sundries furnished Peter McDonald.
Extracts from Minutes of Council re land grants to Sir John Johnson.
Account of Quit Rents for Island of Prince Edward to May 1805.
to Alex.MacDonell. Will do all in power to assist.Scales and weights rec'd. but one of 56 lbs.short. Requests that he come to Niagara.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant for goods supplied through order of A.MacDonell.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant for goods supplied through order of Doctor Sims.

Statement of Lands. Sold ( or granted as a reward for services ) by desire of the Right Hon Earl of Selkirk on the undermentioned Townships in Prince Edward Island with the payments by the several purchasers Nov.1807.
Account of Mr.Burns with John Chartnes. For work done and goods received.
An account of Mr.Thompson's sale of owes at Chillingham's barn in Northumberland.

to Lord Selkirk. Williams will probably forward letter that he has prepared by way of Pictou. Has filled an information exofficio against Dr. McAuley for libel on Chief Justice. Requests that enclosed be laid before Council.

to Alex. McDonell. Much distressed at settlers not being moved up Bear Creek sooner and at Genl.Hunter's conduct. Approves of removal of sick to Sandwich. Instructions re bargaining for farm lands. Yeilds to breaking up of Baldoon Settlement, but no intention of giving up altogether. States recommendations presented to Council re Shawanee Townships and also those re care of sheep at Baldoon. Requests copy of Hamly's field notes and survey,and levels for drainage of Settlement. Also report of employment of settlers and estimates in detail of expenditure at Settlement.
to Wm.Burns. Encloses letters for Trisberger & Young. Will have opportunity of delivering them at Moravian Village. Mr. Askin at Lake St.Clair can be trusted and can give information.
Estimate of Gov.DesBarres of the expense for defraying the exigencies of His Majesty's Government in Prince Edward Island.

to Earl of Selkirk. Harvest good at Settlement. Dr.Richardson offers his services in place of Dr.Sims.Mr.T.Smith of Sandwich willing to take survey of islands. Has rec'd answer re petition presented to Lt-Gov. Mrs.Mc.recovering from recent illness. Mill greatly needed at Settlement. Awaits communication referred to in letter of 31 March.
Vouchers.Alex.MacDonell per Peter MacDonell per account between 4 Jan. & 31 Dec.1809.
Invoice of goods purchased by Alex.MacDonell from Thomas Clark.

Affidavit of Richard Cavendish M.A.(Lord Bishop of Durham.) Re the last will and testament of Ralph Gibson. Said will was proved,approved and registered and goods were granted to Wm.Burns,etc,sole executor, on 24th March 1764.Annexes will.
to Wm.Burns. His letter of 4th ultimo duly received.Encloses three letters received a few days ago.
Abstract of American accounts.
Receipt of W.J.& Fr.Lasselle for $200 from Mr.Wright per freight on Mr.Burns trunk.
Burns' bill for liquor,meals and lodging.
Receipt of John McMeaking for $200 for work done for Alex. Brown.
account with Wm.Brown,tailor.
Account current of Lord Selkirk with Leroy, Bayard & McEver.

to John McDonald of Glenaladale. Re conduct of James Williams.His failure to transmit proper accounts and at the proper time.Investigation by Mr.Hall. His report.Failure of Williams to appear in England as directed. State principal heads of articles that Williams is acountable for.Requests advice as to method of proceeding in Williams case.

to Selkirk. Information re death of Mr. Russell on 30th ulto.Col. Green cannot be appointed as his successor owing to a previous appointment.Is advised by Gov. to perserve in efforts to secure the position.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with Matthew Dolsen for $380.30
List of Settlers at Baldoon and number in each family.
Inventory of Attested Copies of conveyances of land &c to Lord Selkirk sent out by Mr.Stewart to be registered in Prince Edward Island.
Extract of letter to James Stewart apparently from Lord Selkirk.Necessity of sending confidential person to P.E.I. Suggests renumeration for Mr.Fraser for his trouble.

to Wm.Burns. Is sending Peter McDonald along with several Highlanders as per Lord Selkirk's directions,also a few sheep and some seeds to be planted. Desires to hear from him, as to his health, on his mother's account.
Itemized account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant for £100-18-3,N.Y.Cy.
Account of Alex. MacDonell with Lord Selkirk from Jany to June 1810.

to James Williams. Requests that he submit all books vouchers and documents relative to affairs in P.E.I. to Mr.Solicitor Stewart for perusal, and also that he submit a monthly statement of all transactions to Mr.Stewart.

to Wm.Burn. Refers to his letter of Apl.29 and June 16.Has resolved to go round by Boston and perhaps New York.Requests that he meet him at New York or as near as possible. Instructions as to route,sheep. Etc. Mr.Gordon to be kept posted.
Return of sheep at farm of Baldoon.
Extract( apparently from Journal kept by Burn) from Jan'y. 16 to April 20 1804. Also sheep account for 1803.
Receipt of Alex.Brown for board and washing from Elias Ross.
Extract ( Apparently from Journal of Wm. Burn) re expenses and miscellaneous subjects.
Observations of longitude and latitude of Upper Canada.

to Alex. MacDonell No result as yet from recommendation given to Treasury re Receivership. Awaits receipt of survey of Wedderburn. Wool received carelessly sorted. Directions re future marking and shearing of sheep.Encloses specimen of mode in which book for specifying sheep may be kept. Several enquiries re Dr.Sims from his friends in Glasgow.
Extract from the Journal of the House of Assembly, Prince Edward Island, re Assessment on land,militia and public buildings.

to James Stewart. States James Williams' conduct of late and requests that an investigation be made as to state of affairs in Prince Edward Island.Will be quite satisfied with his report. Has statement of expenditure from Williams up to Oct.1804.
to Wm.Burn. Introduces Alex. Brown,the shepherd,who will accompany him to New York.
Account of Lord Selkirk with John Dolsen for £30-1-4.Receipted by John Dolsen.
Receipt of Matthew Dolsen for £59 2d.N.Y.Cy.in full of accounts to date rec'd from Alex. MacDonell.
Receipt of Lionel Johnson for Wm.Burn for 25 dollars.
Account of Wm.Burn with Lord Selkirk.
Account of George Sweener with Lord Selkirk from June to Sept.1810.
to Wm.Burns. Order to give Maconee leg of whiskey and tabacco.
Vouchers for Brown's travelling expences and purchase of a chain.
Observations of Jone's survey of the road from Grand River to Chatham.

to Selkirk Lt-Gov.Gore satisfied with orders re table of fees for land at Settlement. Present settlers not willing to move to Shawanee Township,but future settlers will be located there. Will make arrangements with the Chief re St.Mary's Isle. Will proceed to Baldoon after prorogation of Legislature. Thorpe has carried his election in York,Durham and Simcoe. Dismissal of Mr. Sheriff Willcocks is requested of Lt.Gov. Nothing done re Grand River lands as yet. Requests commands re block No.4.of same,also information re agreement with Mr.Sims.
List of totles of Land pr.Jo.Stewart.

to Selkirk. Was taken prisoner at Fort George and has been at Cheshire since 15 Aug. Requests that any communication to him be under cover to Messrs.Gerrard,Yeward,Gillespie & Co. of Montreal.Cannot give details.Letter to be inspected.
Statement of Dr. John Sims. re his office as physician to Baldoon Settlement.

to Earl of Selkirk. Sheep not brought from Baldoon to Lake Ontario,owing to bad roads; great loss has thus been caused.Encloses copy of attested account of property pillaged,destroyed and taken by Americans.Also copy of list of articles secreted. Settlement of concerns at Baldoon cannot be detainded till peace is established with U.S. Advice re sheep.MacDonell not yet drawn for money due him.Requests that his disbursements be paid to Messrs.Gillespie,Gerrard & Co.,London.Thanks for land donated to him. Requests situation or office for brother.Reinforcement of troops badly needed.
to Alex.MacDonell. Encloses papers for his observations thereon.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Thomas Clark.
to Wm.Burn. Encloses account of articles furnished. Has drawn on him in favor of Wm.McCrae.
Certificate of baptism of William Burn,Junior,dated Aug.2nd 1758. Given and signed by James Somerville, Minister.
Table shewing the state of population in a district.
Estimates and instructions,James Williams.
to Wm.Burn. Encloses two letters,one from Miss Bacon and one from Capt.Cunningham.Has informed Miss B., as requested by her, as to time of his Burn's return to Britain.Will be glad to hear from him.

to Lord Selkirk. Gives list of expenses incurred at settlement. Did not think it prudent to do anything re Township road. List of families to which he has given deeds of bargains and sale for 50 acres each and sketch of tract purchased on Grand River,also a few suggestions. Encloses copy of Mitchell's account.People at Baldoon in good health.McLean likely to become a resident. Mr.Russell declining rapidly.
Account of Charles Fisher for Blacksmith work done at Baldoon.
Receipt of Andrew Westbrook to Lord Selkirk for $257.56

to Wm.Burn. Arrived fortnight ago.Good news of sheep and himself.Cannot wait longer on account of thaw. Orders to proceed to Chatham and Dover and go according to directions given at York. Will write Mr.Clark re cash for things that must go on before he arrives.Is to find work and take care of Jasper Young whom he sent from Montreal.
Lunar observations at York, U.C. No. 23.
Plan of River St-Clair per Harrow and Harsen. Nos. 11,12,14,17,68, & 13.

to Selkirk. Thanks for solicitation made for him at the Treasury.Rec'd letter from Col.Claus re cession of Indian land on S.W.side of Gd.River to Crown. Saw Lt-Gov. and requested that deed be made out for Mr.Dickson.Is advised by Claus not to press Indians for surrenders. Has petitioned to surrender lots under water in Dover and locate elsewhere,also for 2000 acres for ten young men of settlement,but is disappointed in both Dr.Sims leaves settlement at expiration of engagement unless other arrangements are made.Condition of sheep is favorable and they will be marked shortly.Has been reluctantly compelled to draw on Ransome,Moreland & Co. Has sent Alex. Brown for ram in possession of Mr.Farquharson at Schenecteday.Is bringing up a Canadian stallion bought for Governor.

to Selkirk . Information re wreck of Schooner Speedy and sickness at Baldoon. Case of utter want at Settlement. Condition of land. Advises that no sheep be added to present number until they have had a season at Baldoon. Has advised Brown the Shepherd to continue services for another year. Necessity of a medical man at Baldoon. Requests instructions re disposal of fatherless and motherless children.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with Matthew Dolsen for goods rec'd.from Nov.1809 to May, 1810. With explanations.

Leroy,Bayard & McEvers to Selkirk. Have disposed of Bank stock and annex statement of his account current. Upon which interest will be allowed at settlement. Request power of Attorney for dividends.Encloses form established by Treasury of U.States. Draft in favor of Wm.Burns will be honored.
to Wm.Burns. Has rec'd his letter of yesterday's date. No article for Lord Selkirk has arrived.
Account current of Alex. MacDonell with Lord Selkirk for 1804.
Receipt of James Johnston for money received on several charges against Daniel Band.
Receipt of Wm.Allan & Co. for Alex.MacDonell for book purchased.
Order of Lord Selkirk re payment of sum of money due Thomas Clark for cash and sundry supplies and travelling expences.
Alex.MacDonell's Drafts on Ranson,Moreland and Company.
Account of Angus McDonald,shepherd of Baldoon,with Lord Selkirk,1810.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Thomas Clark from June to August.

to Selkirk. Dr.Richardson an eye-witness of state of settlers at Baldoon. Only family remaining is McKenzie's. Report as to deaths, survivors,and conditions at Baldoon. Requests further instructions re re-establishment of settlement in another place. Condition among horses, sheep, and of crops. Refers to his large expenditure on Baldoon.

Memorandum.Letter to Alex.MacDonell. Re accounts. Trial of another season at Baldoon.Road on Township line. Drainage of Settlement. Surveys.Apprentising of P. McD's children,and inventory of farm stock.

to Lord Selkirk. States reason for delay in proceeding to England.Capt. McDonald of Tracadie taken suddenly ill but improving. House of Assembly sitting. Has taken up question of land tax as payment of Militia.
Memorandum.Letter to Alex.MacDonell. (Unsigned.) Re purchase of land,horse,sheep,lumber.Also instructions to follow.

to Wm.Burn. Gives list of articles sent up to the care of Innes & Grant,also encloses key for his trunk which is in care of Mr.Wright. Has not rec'd any accounts from Ld.Selkirk. The boy Jasper has arrived and has been set at work.
Account current of Lord Selkirk with Alex.MacDonell from 14th Oct.1806 to 4th Mar.1808.

to Selkirk. Account of battle of Queenston Heights and death of Major General Sir Isaac Brock.Number of killed and wounded in Canadian Army. Requests that his family receive his Lordship's protection,should he fall.
Plan.Different concessions of land in ( ? ) and lots in each concession.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with Thomas Clark from Jan. 6-Oct 1810.
Receipt of J.S.Woods, attorney for Margaret Johnston, for money received as amount of charges in action taken against him by said M.Johnston.
Account current of Lord Selkirk with Alex.MacDonell between Jany 5 and Dec.31,1801.
Account of Alex. MacDonell with Matthew Dolsen for freight of Schooner Dover for August 15, 1809.
Receipt of Jediah Wood for $15 received for grazing sheep.
Account of Wm.Burn with Robert Miller.Sept.12,1803.
Account of Wm.Smith for services.from July 13 to 2 Sept.
Will of Ralph Gibson. Witnesses:William Corby and John Archibald.
Abstract from Cash Book kept by James Williams.
Account of John Brown with Lord Selkirk from Jany to Sept. 1810.
Affidavit of Dr. Angus McAuley relative to a charge in prosecution against the Society of the Loyal Electors before His Excellency in Council.
Plan of part of Prince Edward Island showing lands disposed of. Sea coast,lands not disposed of,and roads.
Sketch of New Baldoon Farm per Mitchell.
Account current of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant for 1809-1810.
Receipt of Hugh McCallum for 2/3 price of a horse sold to Lord Selkirk.
Receipt of Lionel Johnson for above corn and messenger service to Baldoon.
Receipt from John Brown for Indian Cor rec'd. from Lionel Johnson.
List of Drafts of Mr.Williams on Ranson,Moreland & Co.
Ransom,Moreland & Co.to Lord Selkirk. Notice of Receipt of Bill of Messrs.Moffatt & Co. and also return of of Note of Aug. Will attent to William's draft.
Sketch of the North Branch of Bear Creek,with observations and Map of N.W.Territory of the U.S. Shwwanee Township.Township of Dover,River St.Clair, and Dover and Chatham.

to Lord Selkirk. Letter of Dec. 6 rec'd. Will attend immediately to enclosure.Encloses report of trial lately held at Halifax. Son Edward with Sir John Warren will be sent to Mr.Hall When he obtains command of a ship.Congratulations and regards to Selkirk family.

to Selkirk. Arrived on 2nd April and called settlers together to inform them of removal from Baldoon to River Thames. Decided to give Baldoon another trial. Arrived at Sandwich 15th to get seeds,trees and men. Sheep have suffered much. Those remaining receiving great care. Will write to Messrs. Roxburgh of Montreal and Clark of Queenston for articles for Settlement.
Receipts for money and goods rec'd from Mr.Mure and charged to Lord Selkirk's account,signed by James William.Also list of receipts.

to James Stewart. (Enclosed in James Stewart's to Lord Selkirk of 12,Nov. 1806.) States proceeding in regard to investigation of conduct of James Williams also the condition of Lord Selkirk's lands in P.E.I. Settlers dissatisfied over land division and Williams' conduct.
to Thomas Clark. Order to pay $54.05 to Mathias Crow on account of Lord Selkirk.
to Thomas Clark order to pay Alex.Brown $20. on account of Lord Selkirk.
to . Order to pay $40.to Alex.Brown on account of Lord Selkirk.
to Thomas Clark. Order to pay $100 to Matthew Dolson on account of Lord Selkirk.
Memorandum.Letter to Alex.MacDonell.Re miscellaneous subjects.
Copy of Accounts of Mr.Williams and Mr.Mure respecting Lord Selkirk's American business from 1803 to 31 Oct.1804.
Account of Alex. MacDonell with Innis & Grant for Baldoon Settlement.
to Wm.Burns. Enclosing letter from Lord Selkirk and begs that he write him regarding $200. sent him to care of Mr. Hill in Albany.
to Lt-Gen' Hunter. Is commanded to signify His Majesty's pleasure for granting 1200 acres of land to Lord Selkirk for the establishment of a settlement. Conditions of grant.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant from April-July,1808.

to MacDonell. Not enough information re Wainfleet to judge practicability of applying for it. Does not disapprove of views re Receivership,but can give no assistance as yet. States Dr. Sim's terms of employment.Encloses copy of Mitchell's account for which he claims he was refused payment.Wool of this year to be forwarded to London with field inventory and valuation.Requests statement of Burn's effects and account for information of his relatives.
Account of Wm.Burn with M.Dolson for goods purchased.
Deposition of John McDonald of Baldoon. Denying statements made against character of Margaret Johnson of same place.
Memorandum letter to James Stewart of Halifax.Re letter sent to Williams. Power of Attorney.Replacement of Williams if necessary.Examination of accounts. Enclosed draft from W.M. private debt.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant to Mdse ordered by Alex.MacDonell.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant to merchandise ordered by Alex.MacDonell.

to Wm.Burn. Has had trouble finding pasture for sheep.Has lost three lambs.Johnstone coming to take charge of sheep while he goes to Albany for 800 more. Has shown Lord Selkirk last winter's account of expense list and he seems pleased. Is sending stockings by Mr.Jolson and hat for Sam by Mr Johnstone. Begs that he write regarding his men
Account of sundries supplied to Peter McDonald charged to account of Alex.MacDonell.

to Wm.Burn. Refers to his letter of 29th April. Has been prevented unexpectedly from sailing. Directions to proceed to Niagara to visit that part of the country and collect information re pasture for sheep. Has written to Gov'r Hunter re grant to Maj.MacDonell.

Extract of letter to Jos.Stewart from Lord Selkirk. Is sending desired copies of letter to Cartwright.Still puzzled over Williams conduct.Has written Capt.McDonald re same. Requests copy of patent for lot 57 in P.E.I.
List of sheep at Bear Creek taken the 20th of June, 1808.
Order of Thos.Smith in favor of Innis & Grant for £21-12s-2d. Provl. Cy.
to Hugh McDougald. Splendid encouragement at Baldoon of settlers. Advice re clothing,money, and food.
Account current. Lord Selkirk with Alex. MacDonell from Sept 30-Dec 31,1810.
List of number of sheep shorn.
Account of Wm.Burns with Matthew Dolson from March to May 1804.
Scroll (Copy.) Letter Selkirk to Alex. MacDonell.Re his claim for services as Sherriff and application for recommendation to other office.
List of articles received per the Hunter.
Receipt of Wm.Shaw for Alex.MacDonell for money received.

to Selkirk. Met the Lt.-Gov. 10 miles above Dolson's on River Thames on 25th and escorted him to Amherstburgh.Number of Indians awaiting his arrival. Sounded by Claus as to sale of two Reservations. Spoke to them re purchase made by His Lordship.Met Mr.Sterling on board the Camden.Morlet's plan on too large scale.He(MacDonell) has been returned as a Member for Glengarry.Mrs.MacDonell ill.People well and crops in good condition at Baldoon.
Bargain with John Mitchell as to salary for services.
Account of Wm.Burn with Matthew Dolson from Jany -Feby,1804.Also miscellaneous receipts in connection with his accounts.
Memorandum letter to James Williams re plans and papers. Explanations and accounts. Settlement of matters of home satisfactory.

Memorandum.Letter to Alex.MacDonell. Re medical assistance at Baldoon.The settlers. Wool restriction.Accounts and drafts. Hamly's survey. Lots in the Settlement. Care of sheep. Drainage and sewing of seed.Mississaga as a place of settlement. Gown and linen requested.
Account of Wm.Caldwell with Lord Selkirk from June to Sept.1810.
Account of Lord Selkirk with John Dolson for May-Oct. 1807.

to Lord Selkirk. Has rec'd from Gen'l.Fanning a letter of Mr.Williams.Only information obtainable at present. Will make enquiries for further. No remittance as yet from Mr.Mure for Mr.Hutchison's mines lots.
Receipt of Joseph Thompson for $8 and an order on Innis & Grant for $16 rec'd from Alex.MacDonell.
Receipted Bill for Peter MacDonell's board by James Ross to Alex.MacDonell's account.
Order of George Tumer to pay John Brown enclosed account and charge to his account.
Account of Innis & Grant with Lord Selkirk for sundries furnished Peter McDonald's children at Amherstburgh.

Scroll Copy.Letter to Thomas Clark from. Requests that he go to Baldoon to settle affairs there. Encloses letter of authority. Statements from MacDonell very unsatisfactory. Details in connection with MacDonell's administration as Agent. Encloses also letter for Dr.Sims from wife and also an answer to Lionel Johnson to be forwarded.
to Wm.Burn. List of articles which he will receive by their boat. The steel being in the bottom of the vessel was delayed but will be sent by next opportunity,also two men.

to Wm.Burn. Requests that he meet him at York.Orders re care of sheep.Leaves a horse and saddle at Drakes', Queenstown for him. To bring memos.and accounts to York with him. Savage not to wait but to return to York.All letters to him to be forwarded to York.
Copy of Mr.Mitchell's list of sheep.
Tredell's field notes on survey of Dover: Nos. 3,4,5.

to Selkirk. Leaves for Baldoon on 8th.Will forward Clark's account and detailed statement on return to York. Drawn on Ransom Moreland & Co. for the amount.Rec'd letter from Col.Claus re cession of Indian lands to Crown.
List of Alex.MacDonell's drafts.

to Wm.Burns. Have been obliged to bring boat here and now return her with provisions.Frenchman who goes along with Jas.Burn said to be paid by Mr.Innes. Scows can be had from McRae at any valuation that may be put upon them. Road to be opened on Township line not to be bargained for till MacDonell returns. Has settled with Bissell for boards. Encloses note of directions from D.Shaw and a letter from Mr.Hamby.
End of a letter of John Fleeming.(Unaddressed.) First part torn and incomplete.
Memo. of G.Arthur. For Mr.Wm.Burty,Kirkland, re weight of oxen bred and fed by Sir Hendrey Grey.K.B., in Northumberland 1795.
Wm.Burns'account with H.Brew for lodging and liquor.
to Wm.Burn. Encloses order for $95 as per John Hyslop's note in favor of Alex.Brown. Thanks for attention to Mr.Donaldson. Offers his services if ever required.
to Lord Selkirk. Will proceed to carry out his instructions. Gives description of townships as to land,timber,etc.
to Wm.Burns. Encloses letter from Lord Selkirk. Has sent order for $200 requested to Mr. Hills in Albany.
Receipt of Wm.Burn for $550 received from Lord Selkirk.
Amount of wages paid to Mr.Burns for the years 1802-03-04.Other miscellaneous accounts.
to Lord Selkirk. Son Edward well deserving of any attention bestowed upon him.Williams affair in Island going on very well.Encloses letter of Mrs. Stewart for Lady Katherine.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Wm.Burn From May-July.
Sketch of survey of R.St-Clair, No. 1.

to Lord Selkirk. Only rec'd his letter on April 2 on Aug.10. States steps taken re its enclosures.Williams to leave by ship now in harbour.Thanks for interference on his behalf respecting Attorney-Generalship.
to Wm.Burns. Encloses letter rec'd from Ld.Selkirk .Williams and settlers to winter at P.E.I. Offers his services.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant from July 1808 to Jan.,1809.
Statement of Account current for Lord Selkirk by Leroy Bayard & McEver.

to Lord Selkirk. Leaves for Baldoon on 30th taking with him the title deeds.Has located the 2800 acres.Is getting a plan of Shawanee Township from the Surveyor General's Office. Awaits commands re Block No.4.of Grand River lands. Greater accommodation in having credit at Montreal than in New York. Is compelled to draw in favor of Mr.Clark for monies advanced by him. Encloses list of his lands and requests that Mr.Muir dispose of same on account.
to Wm.Burn. Is anxious to see him.Requests that he send the Surveyor directly and that he write until he is able to come himself.
to Wm.Burns. Requests ten or twelve pieces of pork which he will return as soon as Capt. Harrow arrives.Sends a groving axe. Requests that the bearer of the letter be sent back immediately.
Itemized account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant.
to Lord Selkirk. Re agreements re cutting lumber left for his perusal.
to Wm.Burn. Pork and flour requested are now ready and more if wanted. Will try to give satisfaction in respect to other articles.
Spraggon,May & Co.to James Williams. Has taken necessary steps aggreable to arrangements and has written to Mr.Ritchie accordingly.
to Wm.Burn. Borrowing five dollars.
Queries re sheep.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Wm.Burn,his agent,for expenses incurred.
Account of Alex. MacDonell with Richard Pattinson.
Account of Thomas Clark with Archibald Thompson per Peter MacDonell's board and clothing.
Account of Charles Fisher with Lord Selkirk for goods and sheep supplied to Baldoon in 1808.
Plan of arrangement for farming the sheep stock on Baldoon,U.C. Copy sent to Mr. MacDonell May 3rd,1808.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Mathias Dolsen for Feb. & March,1809.
Receipt of Matthew Dolsen for an order on Thomas Clark's account from Alex.MacDonell.
Order in Chancery on motion of William Roubel re estate of Earl of Selkirk.
to Lord Selkirk. Encloses duplicate of letter of 16 April. Is on lockout for successor to James Williams at P.E.I.Settlement.
to Wm. Burn. Notification of illness of his man and employment of another in his place.
to Selkirk. Has succeeded in a conditional purchase of Lot No. 5 Grand River lands from Mr.Jarvis.
Account of Lord Selkirk to Thomas Clark from July 1808 to Jany. 1809.

to Wm.Burns. Vessel containing sheep sent by Lord Selkirk wrecked of North of Scotland but sheep are safe. Intends to send some of them to him at New York. Has great fear of another visit from Bonaparte. No news from Selkirk since he sailed from Tobermorry.
Extract of letter to Lionel Johnson. Re investigation by Mr.Thomas Clark of Queenston and land requested.
Plan of Shawanee Township showing Bear Creek per Jones.

to James Williams. Discusses settling of 800 or 900 passengers who sail beginning of June.Requests that he bring full inventory of all moveable property left on Island to England.John McDonald's conduct not deserving of any attention.Any further documents in his possession to be sent home. Has rec'd claim from Donald McDonald for £18 for expences of travelling.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Alex.MacDonell from 1st Jany. to 30 Sept. 1810.

to Selkirk. Has taken passage by the Camden.Clark left in charge at Baldoon. All necessary arrangements have been made.Sale of Stedman's Townships not yet sanctioned,to be put up at public sale. Dickson leaving for London in course of month.

to Lord Selkirk. Arrival at Sandwich of Allan McDougal with news of more deaths at Baldoon. Will remove all settlers from there and has asked assistance of Doctor Richardson of Amherstburgh. River St.Clair out of the question as place suitable for settlers to be moved to. Has rented houses at Sandwich for sick.

to Wm.Burns. Expresses his disappointment at not being at home when he(Burns) called. After his return from Sandwich will call if not convenient for him to call at Chatham.Has left bbl.of Whiskey at Mrs.Dolsons.

to Selkirk. Wishes his opinion re the recent purchase of land in Grand River Township. Has not proposed removal to Shawanee Township to settlers. Dr.Sims desirous of getting a location. Home farm conditions very favorable. Many applications for land below Little Bear Creek.Encloses list of number of bags and their respective weight.
Extract of letter (parts missing) re Settlement of Baldoon.
to Alex.MacDonell ( Inclosure in McDonell's to Selkirk, 4th May 1803.) .Notice of expiration of his credit put in their charge and to his favor by Ld.S.
Memorandum of the Agreement. Between Lord Selkirk and Spraggon,May & Co. for lease of saw and grist mill in Pinneth River,P.E.I., for 20 years.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with John and James McGregor.
Account of Alex.MacDonell with the Government for freight.
to Selkirk. Requests that he have his bill for £250 stg. Drawn on Messrs. Ransom,Moreland & Co. honored.Wright appointed butler to Lt-Gov,at $250 par annum.
to Alex. MacDonell. Anxiously awaits results of people remaining at Baldoon another season.Instructions re removal of people to Shawanee Townships.
to Innis & Grant. Order to pay £2 N.Y.Cy to Donald MacPherson and charge to Lord S's account.
Order of Alex.MacDonell in favor of James McMaster and to account of Lord Selkirk.
Order of John McDonald on Hugh McCallum in favor of Innis & Grant.

to Lord Selkirk. Reports re Settlement in P.E.I. Sums of money received. Purchase and distribution of oat meal. Money expanded on and progress of road work. Saw mill,dam and grist mill. Use of cattle and grain in place of money.Industry of 1803 people in improving their lands and sales of land. Begs to be allowed to explain his conduct in person instead of thrD Mr.Stewart.

to Lord Selkirk. Will not he able to comply with any command he may receive on account of lateness of season and necessity of devoting his time to the removal of his family to Long Island. Has issued measures for ensuing winter,to Clark. Also sundry documents including his own account. Has requested that he pay yearly interest due to Indians. Will continue labours until order of recall is received. In sending plan and field notes of Smith's survey to Clark. Transmits suggestions re letting of Rams on shares.Encloses copy of receipt found in waistcoat pocket of late Wm.Burns sold to John Brown.
Inventory of Wool at Martin's in Upper Canada.
to Mrs.Bacon. Introduces Wm.Burn,his agent,whom he wishes to hire labourers.Will confirm the bargains he makes.
Account of Quit Rents on lot 60 P.E.I.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Robert Gouir for October and November 1804.
to Lord Selkirk. Will proceed to Chenail Ecarte,and to discharge trust placed upon him.
Memorandum re Accounts
List of bonds and cash sent by Alex.MacDonell to Thomas Clark.
Account of late Wm.Burns with Fisher & Williams.

Memorandum.Letter to Alex. MacDonell. Re sickness at Baldoon. Assistance to destitute families. Education of their children.Marriages of elder girls.Necessity of having a priest in the neighbourhood.Marking and shearing of sheep. Invention re distillery. Sowing of crops.Mill for grain.Pamphlets on Education.
to Lord Selkirk. Extract to letter(commencement missing) re purchase of Mr.Spraggon to the extent of £200 stg.
Alex.MacDonell's settlement of the accounts of the late Wm.Burns.
Account of Earl of Selkirk with Innes & Grant per order of Dr.Sims.
receipt for Alex.MacDonell's draft on Ransom,Moreland & Co. in payment of Lord Selkirk's account from Jan.7,1808 to 18th April, 1809.

to Thomas Clark. Sends copy of correspondence between Dr.Sims and self per Alex. Brown.Is anxious to leave Baldoon.States arrangements he would make during his absence.Condition of crops good.Has drawn for $150. in favor of John Brown.

to Alex.MacDonell. Re office of physician to Baldoon.States reasons for wishing to retire therefrom,and reasons for delay in doing so.Offers made him re house to winter in.His frequent requests for money and result; requests for settlement of his accounts.

to Earl of Selkirk. Encloses copy of letter written 2nd Apr.last.Reports on investigation of Alex.MacDonell's books and accoubts.Death of William Burns and Peter McDonald,also on Dr.Sims as a medical man for Baldoon. Has done all in power to complete arrangements for care of farm during MacDonell's absence. Encloses sketch of all moveable property belonging to the Settlement.Wool of present year along with that of 1809 on its way down. Report on land between Baldoon and River La Trench and people willing to settle thereon.Further opinion on farming concerns in Province and emigration of settlers. Encloses packet from MacDonell containing statements of Burn's accounts. Information as to whereabouts of Dr. Sims.Will go to Baldoon to wind up affairs as soon as MacDonell is recalled to England.Letter for MacDonell with postscripts has been forwarded.
Statement of account current by LeRoy, Bayard & MeEvers.(Enclosed in same to Selkirk.)
Sketches. Lake Michigan to Miramichi River.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Innis & Grant for goods purchased.

to Lord Selkirk. Has,since last letter,put in execution scheme to obtain required information.Has requested presence of Williams. Well spoken of by men from Pictou.Will write when further information is obtained.
account with J.& B.Merritt.
List of articles and their cost.
Alex.MacDonell's account with Lord Selkirk.
Further instructions.(Apparently to Wm.Burn.)
Account of Wm.Burn with D.L.Dickson for passengers on board of vessel.
Planof Settlement of Baldoon re sheep,cattle,horses,tillage,labour,culture of hemp,and rapeseed.Permanent improvements. Settlers, roads and accounts of the Settlement.

to Wm.Burn. Letter written from P.E.I. now of no value.Requests observations on Chenail Ecarte when he returns from Western District.Also copy of Tredell's notes to be sent to Mr. Clarks for him,and that he take care of any samples of potatoe,oats,Early and Dutch oats and Indian corn that may come from the Sheriff.
Receipt of Col.Wm.Claus for interest on sum due on Grand River Lands.

to Selkirk. Has communicated suggestions re Canal and Locations in Wainfleet to Lt-Gov. and requested to be furnished with plans of Wainfleet and Gainsboro. Encloses small sketch of road in Townships.Hasproposed survey of desired part of Wedderburn to Mr.Wilmot. Encloses copy of petition presented to him. Sons of late Peter McDonald very disappointing. Intends taking passage by first boat sailing for Niagara and will endeavor to get David McDonald back. Col.Proctor not willing to free Angus from enlistment with 41st Regt. Willing to give Peter back. Inducements to settlement to Lt-Gov. proved tempting. Shepherd,dogs and overseer desirable at Home farm. Will winter at Baldoon,and go to Fort Erie in Spring to meet settlers and then proceed to Wedderburn.

to Selkirk. Refers to discussion of Ex.Council on application made by Selkirk to Lord Spencer,for grant of islands. Survey of Dover by Smith not yet commenced. Uninformed as to whether Burwell has completed survey of Wedderburn. Believes him a good man for inducing settlers to that Township. The Menonites of Pennsylvania the most desirable settlers. Lots on bank of River cannot be settled on terms proposed. Some Suggestions.Has sent to Montreal for four Canadians in compliance with directions re road and settlement of Township Line. Also to Mr.Clark for sundry articles for the settlement. Encloses his account.With exception of draft for Clark,will not draw further amounts except under restrictions prescribed. Wheat fields good. Promise of wheat to dispose of.People quarrelsome and indolent. Every reason to believe Hugh McCallum to have fled the country.Requests information re  refusal of Govt. of Province to pay him sum due his brother.

to Selkirk. Brant died Nov.24. Indians divided as to choice of new leader. Norton anxious to obtain the leadership. Discontent among Indians over land sold. Information demanded regarding the surveying of a block of their land.Morlet's minutes transmitted to Council. Has given the trustee for the Indians,a mortgage on said block. Tract purchased suitable for culture of hemp. Requests permission to name said tract "Wedderburn" after Lady Selkirk.Transmits account of monies rec'd and disbursed Since Oct.14,1806. Also copy of letter from McGillivray in answer to security asked for.
